content: twiddle muff materials- medium weight yarn scrap yarn k hook notes- finished flattened muff is approximately 7 1/2 wide x 10 long exact size isn t essential i used mc gray for odd numbered stripes and a different cc for each even numbered stripe a single color or variegated yarn could be used throughout to change colors complete the last stitch of the stripe knot the yarns together before joining and pull the new color thru at the join trim the knotted ends to 1 and leave them loose on the inside of the muff for added texture fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet bobble = dc5tog in one stitch first stripe mc - chain 46 join with first chain to ninth stripe make a circle round 14- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts rounds 1-3 - chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as join and in each st around join with first half_double_crochet 46 sts tenth stripe second stripe rounds 15 & 16 - chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join round 4- chain 3 counts as a stitch double_crochet in each st 46 sts around join with top of chain 3 46 sts round 5- chain 3 counts as a stitch fpdc in next eleventh stripe st bpdc in next st repeat around ending with round 17- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts fpdc in last st join 46 sts twelfth stripe third stripe round 18- repeat round 7 round 6- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts thirteenth stripe fourth stripe round 19- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts round 7- chain 1 half_double_crochet in same st as join bobble in next st half_double_crochet in next st repeat around ending with fourteenth stripe bobble in last st join 46 sts round 20- repeat round 4 round 21- repeat round 5 fifth stripe round 8- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts fifteenth stripe rounds 22-24 - chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join sixth stripe 46 sts rounds 9 & 10 - chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join fasten_off 46 sts attach ribbons flowers cording tassels and seventh stripe other fiddly bits beads and buttons can be a round 11- chain 1 half_double_crochet in each around join 46 sts choking hazard so check with recipient s care- giver before using them muff is pictured without eighth stripe embellishment so that the stitch detail can be round 12- repeat round 4 seen round 13- repeat round 5 designed by paula joppru please do not reproduce this pattern without permission
